discussion.content: Pretty sure the correct answer here is Project Team Members

CompTIA Project+ Cert Guide: Exam PK0-004 (Pearson IT Certification, 2017) Project team members contribute project expertise and deliverables according to the project schedule. They provide estimations of task duration, costs, and dependencies.

The project team members would be best suited to contribute cost and time estimates for the project activities during the development of a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS).

Project team members are the ones who will be directly responsible for performing the project activities and have the most intimate knowledge of the work that needs to be done. They can provide realistic and accurate estimates based on their experience and expertise.

The project sponsor (B) is responsible for providing overall support and funding for the project, but may not have the technical knowledge to provide cost and time estimates.

The project manager (C) is responsible for overall management of the project, but may not have the detailed technical knowledge to provide cost and time estimates.

The project scheduler (D) is responsible for creating and managing the project schedule, but will typically use the cost and time estimates provided by the project team members to develop the schedule.

Selected Answer: A
A. Project Team Members

questions.question_text:
A WBS is being developed for a project.
Which of the following would be BEST suited to contribute cost and time estimates for the project activities?

discussion.content:
The correct answer is A. A program is a combination of multiple projects.

A project is a temporary endeavor with a defined beginning and end, undertaken to achieve a specific goal. A program, on the other hand, is a collection of related projects managed in a coordinated way to obtain benefits and control not available from managing them individually.
